lines.content: I did not use AI until the very end of the iP, where I used Cursor to help me check for discrepancies and shortcomings in my code with respect to common coding standards, error handling and SLAP.

Cursor helped me to shorten my methods by applying SLAP (particularly in moving most of the parsing logic from src/main/java/udin/Udin.java to src/main/java/udin/Parser.java) and removing duplicate blocks of code. Moreover, Cursor helped me generate more JUnit tests and assertions, since I started out with only a handful of them when I was writing them myself. And, finally, it also helped me resolve an error where the .txt storage file could not be detected if I ran Udin via the JAR file.

It was not perfect though; occasionally, `./gradlew run` did not build successfully after one or two prompts due to a small error which I had to trace back and debug myself. However, Cursor mostly improved my productivity by a large margin when doing humdrum work.

Udin is a personal task management application that helps you organize and track your daily tasks. It supports three types of tasks: todos, deadlines, and events, with a modern graphical user interface.
- ‚úÖ **Task Management**: Create, mark, unmark, and delete tasks
- üéØ **Events**: Schedule tasks with start and end times
- üíæ **Data Persistence**: Tasks are automatically saved and loaded
The GUI will open automatically with a modern interface featuring:
Type these commands in the input field at the bottom of the GUI:
| `todo <description>` | Add a todo task | `todo Buy groceries` |
| `deadline <description> /by <date>` | Add a deadline task | `deadline Submit report /by 2024-12-25 1800` |
| `event <description> /from <date> /to <date>` | Add an event task | `event Team meeting /from 2024-12-25 1400 /to 2024-12-25 1600` |
| `unmark <number>` | Mark a task as not done | `unmark 1` |
Type these commands in the GUI input field:
*Udin responds: "Got it. I've added this task: [T][ ] Buy groceries"*
*Udin responds: "Got it. I've added this task: [D][ ] Submit project (by: Dec 30 2024, 11:59PM)"*
*Udin responds: "Got it. I've added this task: [E][ ] Team meeting (from: Dec 25 2024, 2:00PM to: Dec 25 2024, 4:00PM)"*
*Shows all your tasks in the chat area*
*Udin responds: "Good boy! This task is all done: [T][X] Buy groceries"*
*Udin shows: "Here are the matching tasks in your list: [E][ ] Team meeting..."*
- Tasks are saved immediately after any modification (add, mark, unmark, delete)
The application provides helpful error messages for common issues:
- **Empty todo description**: `The description of a todo cannot be empty.`
- **Invalid date format**: `Please enter date as yyyy-MM-dd HHmm (e.g. 2019-12-02 1800).`
- **Missing search keyword**: `Please provide a keyword to find.`
This project is part of the CS2103T Software Engineering course.
Udin is a personal task management application that helps you organize and track your daily tasks. It supports three types of tasks: todos, deadlines, and events with a graphical user interface.
- ‚úÖ **Task Management**: Create, mark, unmark, and delete tasks
- üéØ **Events**: Schedule tasks with start and end times
- üíæ **Data Persistence**: Tasks are automatically saved and loaded
- üñ•Ô∏è **Dual Interface**: Both CLI and GUI modes available

* The main entry point and controller class for the Udin task manager application.
* This class coordinates interactions between the user interface ({@link Ui}),
* persistent data storage ({@link Storage}), and the in-memory task list ({@link TaskList}).

*
  • Initialize the system by loading tasks from disk
"- bye: End the conversation with Udin, yours truly.\n" +
"- mark <task number>: Mark a task as done.\n" +
"- unmark <task number>: Mark a task as not done.\n" +
"- todo <description>: Create a new to-do task with a description.\n" +
"- deadline <description> <deadline>: Create a new deadline task with a description and a deadline.\n" +
"- event <description> <from> <to>: Create a new event task with a start and end time.\n" +
"- delete <task number>: Delete a task from the task list.\n" +
"All times (for deadline and event commands) must be\n" +
